questions.uddipok: The pie chart below shows the sources of air pollution in a city. Describe the pie chart in 150 words. You should make comparison where necessary.

sub_questions.explanation:
The pie chart displays the various sources of air pollution in a city, highlighting five key contributors. Vehicles are by far the most significant source, accounting for 60% of total air pollution. This indicates a heavy reliance on private and commercial transportation, possibly due to limited public transport infrastructure. Industry is the second-largest contributor at 18% , reflecting emissions from factories and manufacturing units. Power plants contribute 13% , suggesting that electricity generation—likely from fossil fuels—is another major pollutant. Waste disposal activities are responsible for 3% , while heating or using gas contributes nothing ( 0% ), showing negligible or highly controlled emissions in that category.
The disparity is stark: vehicles alone contribute more than all other sources combined, underscoring the urgent need for cleaner transport alternatives and stricter vehicular emission controls. In contrast, waste disposal and gas usage have a minimal impact, suggesting these are not major areas of concern. Targeted interventions in transport and industry could significantly improve air quality.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of the following story and complete it in your own way. Give a suitable title to the story:
There was a naughty cowboy who grazed his cows beside a forest. He used to make fun with people crying Tiger! Tiger!.........

sub_questions.explanation:
Once there was a cowboy. He used to graze cow in the field. There was a forest beside the field. There lived tigers in the forest. The boy was very naughty. He went to the filed to feed the cow. He used to pastime there alone. To make fan, the cowboy used to shout uttering tiger, tiger and the people of nearby locality would come to save him. Seeing them, the cowboy started laughing. The people understood his trick, become bored and went away.
By the way, the boy used to continue his work in the field. One day, when he was grazing the cows in the field, a tiger come truly. He became afraid and started shouting for help to save him life. The people thought that he was making fan again. They did not pay heed to him. Nobody came to save him. Everyone thought that he was making fan with them as usual. The tiger attack the cattle and killed the boy. The boy lost his life for telling lies; He realized at last that if a liar speaks truth, nobody believes it. We can understand from the story that nobody trusts a liar.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Samina. You received a letter from your father yesterday. In that letter, he warned you not to spend much time on Facebook. Now, write a reply to his letter.

sub_questions.explanation:
105 C, West Nakhalpara, Dhaka
05 July 2023
Dear Father,
I received your letter the day before yesterday. My joy knew no bounds to receive the sletter containing much good advice for me.
In your letter I have noticed a great worry about my study and my spending a lot of time on Facebook. But, father, you have nothing to be worried about. I am really very busy with my ensuing HSC Examination. In our college, a special coaching arrangement has been made and we have to participate (অংশগ্রহণ করা) in the scheduled coaching programmes dally. We solve our daily problems in the coaching classes. So, we need not have to bother (মাথা ঘামান) for our studies at our house. As for spending time on facebook, I spend maximum thirty minutes on Facebook daily. This is required in this age of technology. It does not hamper my studies at all, rather I learn many important things out of it. So, please don't worry in this respect. I am very conscious of my studies. We all are well here. Please take care of your health.
Yours affectionately,
Samina

questions.uddipok:
Summarize the following text.
Valentina Tereshkova was born in a village, in Central Russia on 6 March 1937. Her father was a tractor driver and her mother worked in a textile plant. At the age of eight she began her schooling but did not enjoy it much. She left the school within a few years. Afterwards she completed her education through distance learning. She became interested in parachuting from a young age, and trained in skydiving at the local Aeroclub, making her first jump at age 22 on 21 May 1959. It was her expertise in skydiving that led to her selection as a cosmonaut.After the flight of Yuri Gagarin, the first human being to travel to outer space in April 1961, the Soviet Union decided to send a woman in space. On 16 February 1962, "proletaria" Valentina Tereshkova was selected for this project from among more than four hundred applicants. Tereshkova had to undergo a series of training that included weightless flights, isolation tests, centrifuge tests, rocket theory, spacecraft engineering, 120 parachute jumps and pilot training in MiG-15UTI jet fighters. Since the successful launch of the spacecraft Vostok-5 on 14 June 1963, Tereshkova began preparing for her own flight. On the morning of 16 June 1963, Tereshkova and her. back-up cosmonaut Solovyova were dressed in space-suits and taken to the space shuttle launch pad by a bus. After completing her communication and life support checks, she was sealed inside Vostok-6. Finishing a two-
hour countdown, Vostok-6 launched faultlessly. Although Tereshkova experienced nausea and physical discomfort for much of the flight, she orbited the earth 48 times and spent almost three days in space. With a single flight, she logged more flight time than the combined times of all American astronauts who had flown before that date. Tereshkova also maintained a flight log and took photographs of the horizon, which were later used to identify aerosol layers within the atmosphere. Vostok-6 was the final Vostok flight and was launched two days after Vostok-5, which carried Valary Bykovsky into a similar orbit for five days, landing three hours after Tereshkova. The two vessels approached each other within 5 kilometers at one point, and from space Tereshkova communicated with Bykovsky and the Soviet leader Khrushchev by radio.

sub_questions.explanation: Valentina Tereshkova, born in 1937, grew up in Central Russia. She left school early but continued education through distance learning. Passionate about parachuting, she trained extensively and made her first jump at 22. Selected as a cosmonaut in 1962, she underwent rigorous training. On June 16, 1963, she boarded Vostok-6, becoming the first woman in space. Despite feeling discomfort, she orbited Earth 48 times in nearly three days, contributing valuable data. Her flight time surpassed combined American astronaut times. Tereshkova's achievements marked a significant milestone in space exploration.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions:
(a) What does WHO say about adolescence?
(b) How many adolescents are boys and how many are girls in Bangladesh?
(c) How is the condition of the adolescent girls in Bangladesh?
(d) What is the legal age of marriage for boys and girls in our country?
(e) When do the boys become ready for marriage?

sub_questions.explanation:
(a)
The World Health Organization (WHO) defines adolescence as the period of life between 10 and 19 years of age. This stage marks the transition from childhood to adulthood, characterized by significant physical, emotional, and social development. Adolescents experience rapid growth and undergo various changes that influence their health, behavior, and interactions with society.
(b)
According to the 2022 Bangladesh Census, the population of adolescents aged 10–14 is approximately 16.6 million, with 8.5 million boys and 7.8 million girls. For the 15–19 age group, there are about 16.5 million adolescents, comprising 8.1 million boys and 8.5 million girls. In total, adolescents make up about 28.8% of Bangladesh's population, with a near-equal distribution between boys and girls.
(c)
Adolescent girls in Bangladesh face several challenges
Child Marriage : Approximately 51% of girls in Bangladesh are married before the age of 18, making it one of the highest rates globally.
Education : While enrollment rates for girls have improved, many still face barriers to completing secondary education, especially in rural areas.
Health Risks : Early pregnancies pose significant health risks, with many adolescent girls becoming mothers before reaching adulthood.
Violence and Abuse : A significant number of adolescent girls experience physical or sexual violence, often within intimate relationships.
These issues hinder their development and access to opportunities, perpetuating cycles of poverty and inequality.
(d)
In Bangladesh, the legal age for marriage is 18 for girls and 21 for boys, as stipulated by the Child Marriage Restraint Act of 2017. However, the law includes provisions that allow for exceptions under certain circumstances, such as parental consent and court approval, which have been criticized for potentially undermining efforts to prevent child marriage.
(e)
While the legal age for marriage is 21 for boys in Bangladesh, readiness for marriage is influenced by various factors beyond age, including emotional maturity, financial stability, and societal expectations. Cultural norms often dictate that men should be established in their careers and capable of supporting a family before marriage. However, these expectations can vary widely across different communities and regions within the country.

questions.uddipok:
Write a summary of the following passage.
Education aims to bring about positive changes in our behavior. It helps us try to change our lives as well as the society we live in. Education that does not illuminate our minds or does not inspire us to work for the community is not complete at all. Education is not all about getting grades or receiving certificates- we use education to make life better. We are expected to apply the knowledge, skills and values that we learn in a classroom in our engagement with the world that lies outside. And we can do so in many different ways. Let's have a look at how education works. Learners' civic engagement is highly appreciated all over the world. Civic engagement means working to make a difference in the civic life (the public life of the citizens as constructed with private or personal life) of the community using knowledge, skills, values and motivation. Civic engagement promotes the quality of life in a community by contributing to the improvement of health and wellbeing of the people.
Civically engaged individuals recognize themselves as members of a larger social community and are concerned about civic issues. They consider themselves responsible citizens who take action or raise their voices against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills.
In civic engagement, issues of public concern are crucial. Civic engagement includes individual or group activities to protect public interests and change the way the community values itself. For example, If you are protesting against any unjust decision of the local municipality such as raising taxes or an act that might work against people's interests, you are civically engaged and your action is considered a civic engagement. This protest can be done in different ways such as organizing rallies, collecting signatures, making human chains, writing petitions, etc. You can also help control traffic in front of a school, help children to cross the roads, work in a team to clean a park or a sea beach. You can also give some services to elderly people. These are all examples of civic engagement as what you do directly affects the community.
When civic engagement is a part of an academic program, and the learners' engagement is assessed following a scale, then it is called service learning. It involves the application of knowledge and skills learned in the classroom and then making a complete plan of action 1.e. preparing a budget, starting the process of implementation, involving people and activating operational strategies.

sub_questions.explanation: Education plays a vital role in bringing about positive changes in behaviour. It helps us try to change our life as well as our society. Complete education not only illuminates our minds but also inspires us to work for the community. The purpose of education is not getting grades and receiving certificates. The main objective of education is to make life better. Civic engagement of the learners is highly appreciated all over the world nowadays. A civically engaged person works to create a difference in the civic life taking action or raising voice against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills. When we work for social welfare, we are civically engaged. Civic engagement may be individual or group activities. For example, we can raise voice against raising excessive taxes. This protest can be done by organising ralles, collecting signature, making human chains, etc. Learners engagement is evaluated by following a scale. Rnowledge and skills learned in the school is applied. in society for public welfare.
